Context:
* The college is located in Toronto, Canada and has a multicultural student population with nearly 30% being international students.
* The application process involves applying online, checking the application cycle, and meeting admission requirements which vary depending on the country of origin and credential desired.
* Transfer agreements are available with colleges and universities across Canada and internationally.
* Accommodations and internet access are provided for students.
* Information sessions can be attended by registering based on nationality or language.
* Experiential learning is offered to prepare students for the Canadian workforce.
* An English for Academical Purposes (EAP) program with 9 levels is available to improve English skills.
* A viewbook can be downloaded in various languages to learn more about becoming a student at George Brown College.
* Virtual one-on-one meetings with recruitment representatives specialized in students' country of origin can be scheduled for questions.
* Land acknowledgment information is also available.
